channel.title: Latest Technology News and Product Reviews | New York Post
channel.description: Your source for breaking news, news about New York, sports, business, entertainment, opinion, real estate, culture, fashion, and more.

item.title: Twitter down, social network suffers outage as users unable to access timelines

item.title: AirPods maker pressured to speed exit from China amid Beijing-US tensions: report
item.dc:creator: Yuheng Zhan
item.description: The China-based maker of Apple's AirPods is reportedly facing pressure from US tech companies to find new manufacturing locations outside the country amid rising tensions between Beijing and Washington.

item.title: White House gives agencies 30 days to impose federal device TikTok ban
item.dc:creator: Victor Nava
item.description: The White House on Monday ordered government agencies to rid their devices of the Chinese-owned app TikTok within 30 days in an effort to prevent China’s communist government from spying on the US.
item.content:encoded: The White House on Monday ordered government agencies to rid their devices of the Chinese-owned app TikTok within 30 days in an effort to prevent China’s communist government from spying on the US.

media:content.media:title: This file picture taken in Moscow on November 11, 2021, shows the Chinese social networking service TikTok's logo on a tablet screen.

item.content:encoded: The unnamed middle manager took to Blind, the social media app that offers career employees anonymity so they can post freely.

item.title: Google employee Jacob Pratt, 33, found dead of apparent suicide in NYC apartment
item.dc:creator: Ariel Zilber, Tina Moore
item.description: Pratt, a resident of the Bushwick section of Brooklyn, "unexpectedly passed away" on Feb. 16, according to an obit published by the Lansing State Journal.
item.content:encoded: Pratt, a resident of the Bushwick section of Brooklyn, "unexpectedly passed away" on Feb. 16, according to an obit published by the Lansing State Journal.

media:content.media:title: Detroit Cityscapes And City Views
Jacob Pratt, a 33-year-old account manager based in Google's New York City offices, has died.
Jacob Pratt, 33, was found dead in a Manhattan apartment on Feb. 16, according to the NYPD.
Jacob Pratt's mother, Shawn, posted a selfie image of her and her son nearly a week after his death.
Jacob Pratt's LinkedIn page lists him as a partnership lead at Google.

item.title: Peter Thiel’s Palantir cuts around 2% of its workforce

item.description: Earlier this month, Palantir had also said it expects 2023 to be the company's first profitable year as it benefits from cost cuts and the artificial intelligence boom.

item.title: Chinese ‘kissing’ device with ‘real-life silicon lips’ panned as creepy: ‘Where’s the tongue?’
item.dc:creator: Ariel Zilber
item.description: The lips are designed to simulate the pressure, movement, and heat of a lover's lips using sensors -- giving users' a real-life smooching experience.
item.content:encoded: The lips are designed to simulate the pressure, movement, and heat of a lover's lips using sensors -- giving users' a real-life smooching experience.

media:content.media:title: New device allows users to kiss people anywhere in the world over the internet
A new contraption developed by a Chinese tech inventor is eliciting sharp reaction on social media.
The new device is designed to simulate a real-life kiss using silicon lips.

item.title: Elon Musk tweets ‘hope you had a good Sunday’ as 200 Twitter employees fired
item.dc:creator: Ariel Zilber
item.description: "Hope you have a good Sunday," the Twitter owner tweeted. "First day of the rest of your life."
item.content:encoded: "Hope you have a good Sunday," the Twitter owner tweeted. "First day of the rest of your life."

media:content.media:title: Shareholder Trial Against Tesla And Elon Musk
Esther Crawford, who headed the Twitter Blue subscription service, was one of 200 people let go over the weekend.
Esther Crawford went viral in a photo that showed her sleeping in a sleeping bag on the floor of her corporate office.

item.title: Esther Crawford, Twitter exec who slept in office overnight, is fired: report
item.dc:creator: Ariel Zilber
item.description: Esther Crawford was a holdover from the old regime who reportedly gained Musk's trust and elbowed her way into the reclusive mogul's inner circle.
item.content:encoded: Esther Crawford was a holdover from the old regime who reportedly gained Musk's trust and elbowed her way into the reclusive mogul's inner circle.

media:content.media:title: Esther Crawford, the Twitter executive who was seen in a viral photo sleeping on the floor of her office after Elon Musk's takeover of the company, has been fired, according to reports.
Last fall, Crawford was pictured in her sleeping bag on the floor of her office.
Crawford is one of some 200 Twitter employees who were let go over the weekend.

item.title: Last-minute problem keeps SpaceX rocket, astronauts grounded
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: SpaceX did not immediately say when it would try again. The next attempt could come as early as Tuesday, although poor weather was forecast up the East Coast in the emergency recovery area.
item.content:encoded: SpaceX did not immediately say when it would try again. The next attempt could come as early as Tuesday, although poor weather was forecast up the East Coast in the emergency recovery area.

media:content.media:title: From left, pilot Warren Hoburg, Russian cosmonaut Andrey Fedyaev, Commander Stephen Bowen and United Arab Emirates astronaut Sultan al-Neyadi leave the Operations and Checkout building for a trip to Launch Pad 39-A, late on Feb. 26, 2023, at the Kennedy Space Center in Cape Canaveral, Fla.
A SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket with the crew capsule Endeavour sits on pad 39A after the launch attempt was scrubbed at the Kennedy Space Center in Cape Canaveral, Fla. on Feb. 27, 2023.

item.title: Meta unveils new language model in race against ChatGPT rivals
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: The model, which Meta said requires "far less" computing power, is trained on 20 languages with a focus on those with Latin and Cyrillic alphabets.
item.content:encoded: The model, which Meta said requires "far less" computing power, is trained on 20 languages with a focus on those with Latin and Cyrillic alphabets.

item.title: Google workers learned they were fired when emails bounced back, staffer says
item.dc:creator: Ariel Zilber
item.description: Tim Wilde, a site-reliability engineer at Google, told Insider that he found out about terminated employees from posts on LinkedIn and Twitter.
item.content:encoded: Tim Wilde, a site-reliability engineer at Google, told Insider that he found out about terminated employees from posts on LinkedIn and Twitter.

media:content.media:title: MERCEDES-STRATEGY/
Google CEO Sundar Pichai and his management team have been criticized for their handling of recent layoffs affecting some 12,000 employees.
Last month, Google culled 12,000 jobs from its payroll.
Several Google staffers were dismayed at how their now-former colleagues learned of their termination.
